data.Sentence_cn: 我回到家时，肯定已是凌晨两点左右了。
data.Sentence: It must have been about two in the morning when I returned home.

data.Sentence_cn: 我按响了门铃，试图唤醒我的妻子，但她睡得很熟。
data.Sentence: I tried to wake up my wife by ringing the doorbell, but she was fast asleep,

data.Sentence_cn: 于是，我从花园的小棚里搬来了一个梯子，把它靠在墙边，开始向卧室的窗口爬去。
data.Sentence: so I got a ladder from the shed in the garden, put it against the wall, and began climbing towards the bedroom window.

data.Sentence_cn: 快要爬到窗口时，下面一个人用讽刺的口吻说：“我看不必在夜里这个时候擦窗子吧。”
data.Sentence: I was almost there when a sarcastic voice below said, 'I don't think the windows need cleaning at this time of the night.'

data.Sentence_cn: 我向下面看去。当我看清是一个警察时，差一点儿从梯子上掉下去。
data.Sentence: I looked down and nearly fell off the ladder when I saw a policeman.

data.Sentence_cn: 我回答了他的话，但马上又后悔不该那样说，我是这样说的：“我喜欢在夜里擦窗子。”
data.Sentence: I immediately regretted answering in the way I did, but I said, 'I enjoy cleaning windows at night.'

data.Sentence_cn: “我也是的，”警察用同样的声调回答，“请原谅我打断了您。
data.Sentence: 'So do I,' answered the policeman in the same tone. 'Excuse my interrupting you.

data.Sentence_cn: 当一个人在忙着干活时，我是不愿意去打断他的，但请您跟我到警察局去一趟好吗？”
data.Sentence: I hate to interrupt a man when he's busy working, but would you mind coming with me to the station?'

data.Sentence_cn: “可我更愿意呆在这儿，”我说，“您瞧，我忘带钥匙了。”
data.Sentence: 'Well, I'd prefer to stay here,' I said. 'You see. I've forgotten my key.'

data.Sentence_cn: 幸运得很，这喊声惊醒了我的妻子。就在警察开始向我爬上来时，她打开了窗子。
data.Sentence: Fortunately, the shouting woke up my wife who opened the window just as the policeman had started to climb towards me.
